result.markdown: --- title: "Ben Messerly" subtitle: "Physicist at the University of Minnesota" image: "images/messerly_profile.png" execute: echo: false message: false warning: false about: template: trestles #template: jolla image-shape: round image-width: 10em links: - icon: linkedin href: https://www.linkedin.com/in/ben-messerly/ - icon: github href: https://github.com/bamesserly - text: '' href: https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1388-8737 - text: '' href: https://cse.umn.edu/physics/benjamin-messerly - text: '' href: https://inspirehep.net/authors/1224691 --- ::: {.cell} ::: :::{#hero-heading} I'm an experimental nuclear and particle physicist at the [University of Minnesota](https://cse.umn.edu/physics). My work spans particle detector construction, data science, high-performance computing, machine learning, and education. I research the Standard Model theory of fundamental particle physics, and I conduct experiments that try prove it wrong. I also do work in science communication, STEM education and mentorship, and I was recently an assistant professor at [St. Olaf](https://wp.stolaf.edu/physics/) and [Carleton](https://www.carleton.edu/physics-astronomy/). :::
